config.description: This module displays the top 10 data points from an input object using an expandable Accordion component, and provides a detailed view of each key-value pair.
config.name: Response

config.author: Anonymous
code:
# entrypoint.py

import cityflow.module as cm
import cityflow.database as cdb


try:
    data = cm.input["input"]
    step = data["step"]
    observation = data["observation"]
    evaluation = data["evaluation"]
    emotion = data["emotion"]
    plan = data["plan"]
    action = data["action"]

    # update last step obsevation
    if cdb.key_exists(step-1):
        updated_data = cdb.get_data(step-1)
        updated_data["observation"] = observation
        updated_data["evaluation"] = evaluation
        updated_data["emotion"] = emotion
        updated_data["plan"] = plan
        cdb.add_data(step-1,updated_data)

    # output next action
    cm.output.action = {
        "step" : step,
        "action": action
    }

except Exception as e:
    print(e)
config.name: Update Memories

config.author: Anonymous
code:
# entrypoint.py

import cityflow.module as cm
import cityflow.database as cdb


try:
    clear = cm.input["input"]
    print(clear)
    if clear == "true":
        cdb.clear_data()
except Exception as e:
    print(e)
    pass
config.name: Clear Memories

config.discription: this module is useful for adding text to the workspace
config.name: Text
config.value:
# Travel Agent

Ariel Noyman1*, Kai Hu2*, Kent Larson1

1MIT Media Lab, 2South China University of Technology

Understanding human behavior in built environments is critical for designing functional, user-centered urban spaces. We introduce TravelAgent, a novel simulation platform that models pedestrian navigation and activity patterns across diverse indoor and outdoor environments under varying contextual and environmental conditions. TravelAgent leverages generative agents integrated into 3D virtual environments, enabling agents to process multimodal sensory inputs and exhibit human-like decision-making, behavior, and adaptation.

More details: https://www.arielnoyman.com/travelAgent/

Citiation:
Noyman, Ariel, Kai Hu, and Kent Larson. "TravelAgent: Generative Agents in the Built Environment." arXiv preprint arXiv:2412.18985 (2024).
